predicate.note: Frames file for 'acquit' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Ultimately, that carefully picked jury deadlocked with a 10-2 vote *trace* *trace* to acquit, and the prosecution decided not to retry the case.

example.name: passive transitive
example.text: Although Mr. Hastings had been acquitted *trace* by a jury, lawmakers handling the prosecution in Congress had argued that the purpose of impeachment isn't to punish an individual.

example.name: all args
example.text: Mr. Hastings's case was particularly nettlesome because it marked the first time a federal official was impeached and removed from office on charges of which a jury had acquitted him *trace*.
